alert.note: Alert for Berks (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 09 at 4:14PM EDT until July 09 at 8:45PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTH CENTRAL BERKS COUNTY... At 414 PM EDT, trained weather spotters reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain. At 3:54 PM, trained spotters reported street flooding with road closures in Spring Township, PA. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other drainage and low lying areas. Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Wyomissing, Sinking Spring, Womelsdorf, Wernersville, Robesonia, Bernville, New Morgan, Shillington, Mohnton, Kenhorst, West Wyomissing, and Flying Hills. This includes the following highways... Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 27 and 29. Interstate 176 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 5 and 10. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
